info.description: API to validate and retrieve the Bank Identifier Code (BIC) related details. The BIC is the SWIFT Address assigned to a bank in order to send automated payments to the banks concerned. It uniquely identifies the name and country of the bank and consists of 8-11 characters. Example format AAAABBCCDDD, where AAAA: 4 character bank code, BB: 2 character country code, CC: 2 character location code, DDD: optional 3 character branch code.
info.title: Bank Identifier Codes

get.summary: Retrieves the status on the validity of the requested BIC along with its details
get.description: Retrieves the status on the validity of the requested BIC along with its details, such as institution name, address, location etc.

parameters.name: bicId
parameters.description: Bank Identifier Code (BIC) of the Beneficiary bank.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The total number of records per page

parameters.name: page_start
parameters.description: The record from which the response should be displayed

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Unique id expected to get as part of response from t24 on every enquiry request.

parameters.name: credentials
parameters.description: Username and password to authenticate the API against core-banking.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: The identifier of the underlying Entity/Company/Branch.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Identifies the device type

parameters.name: userRole
parameters.description: User who initiated the transaction

get.summary: Retrieves the Bank's legal entity identifier of the requested BIC
get.description: Retrieves the Bank's Legal Entity Identifier (LEI) of the requested BIC. The LEI is the International ISO standard 17442. LEIs are identification codes that enable consistent and accurate identification of all legal entities that are parties to financial transactions, including non-financial institutions.

parameters.description: Bank Identifier Code (BIC) of the Beneficiary bank.

officeType.description: Indicates the status of the entity in the office hierarchy e.g. Head Office, Main Payments Office

groupType.description: Indicates the type of entity that identifies the group eg. Parent or Member

bicbranchCode.description: Indicates the branch Code associated to the BIC Code

countryId.description: ISO country code of the financial institution.

subtypeInd.description: Indicates the type of financial institution

branchQualifier.description: Indicates the branch qualifiers of the Bank Identifier Code (BIC). Branch Qualifiers are the operational type of the entity. Eg: ADM-Administration, BKO for Back Office

validFrom.description: Indicates the date from which the data set becomes effective due to a change of its attributes e.g. BIC activates/deactivates in future

bankLegalEntityIdentifier.description: Legal entity identifier for the bank.
